channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL

item.title: Report E-2025010431
item.description:
Report E-2025010431

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1510ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal NBM in Bessemer, AL. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of WELD-ON 719 CLEAR released from (1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to improper loading (load shifted during transit and buckets fell over). 3-4 buckets were dented but only one bad enough to leak and it is the only one being held back. The release impacted trailer# 3113513. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2025010765
item.description:
Report X-2025010765

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: TUSCUMBIA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a slight smell emanating from ETCX 21090. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was determined that the release was the result of the bolts on the Vapor Valve mounting flange were less than tool tight. These bolts were tightened, and the leak was stopped. There was no impact to the surrounding area. New Seals were placed, and the Shipper was notified.
